intro: Jacquemontia villosissima, commonly known as the hairy false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, which includes morning glories and bindweeds. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and heart-shaped leaves, and it produces clusters of small, white to pale purple flowers. It thrives in moist, disturbed soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks. The fruit is a capsule that releases tiny seeds, aiding in its spread through wind and water.
